sourceDesc.p: Converted from a Word document written by mharty

list.item: convert those “,” things to just comma
for MH text files, insert corresponding MH citation

body.p: “I discover that I. Dugan found the eggs of my snapping turtle of June 7th ap- the same day. It did not go to a new place then after all- I opened the nest today- It is perhaps 5 or 6 rods from the brook- in the sand near its edge. The surface had been disturbed over a foot & a half in diameter- & was slightly concave. The nest commenced 5 inches beneath & at its neck was 2 ½ inches across & from this nearly 4 inches deep- & swelled out below to 4 inches in width. –Shaped like a short rounded bottle with a broad mouth- & the surrounding sand was quite firm. I took out 42 eggs closely packed –an Dugan says he had previously broken one which made 43. Daniel Foster says he found 42 this summer in a nest in his field in Princeton. They are a dirty white & spherical a little more than 1 & 1/16 of an inch in diameter- soft shelld so that my finger left a permanent dimple in them.”
"XVII / 13 February-3 September 1854 / NNPM MA 1302:23 / PE 8, p.208 vol.8; Torrey JVI & JVII, p.#"
